page.title: 18Education - Residential.
page.content: Milton Hall School, run by the Sunderland Education Authority, provides residential care for boys with special needs. These boys, between the ages of eleven and sixteen come from Sunderland and North Tyne. Facilities in the school are good, with a high pupil-teacher ratio. There are pleasant grounds, playing fields and a play barn for wet days. Most of the staff live on the premises and as well as their teaching duties, supervise other activities. There are care and domestic staff as well as teachers. The number of pupils has been steadily falling and is now down to seventeen so there is some doubt as to whether the school will remain open much longer.
